text: Jean-Jacques-Régis de Cambacérès, Duke of Parma ( 18 October 1753 – 8 March 1824), was a French nobleman, lawyer, freemason and statesman during the French Revolution and the First Empire. He is best remembered as one of the authors of the Napoleonic Code. Category:French lawyers Category:Presidents of the National Convention Category:Politicians from Montpellier Category:Freemasons Category:1753 births Category:1824 deaths
title: Jean-Jacques-Régis de Cambacérès
